comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; de; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; de; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)

If you evaluate a compiled XPathExpression with a context node than the expression will not be evaluated for that context.

Testcase:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="de">
    <head>
        <title>Test XPathExpression</title>
    </head>
    <body>
        <form id="testform1" action="#testform1" method="post">
            <fieldset>
                <label for="testinput2">TestInput1:</label>
                <input id="testinput1" type="text" required="true"/>
            </fieldset>
        </form>
        <form id="testform2" action="#testform2" method="post">
            <fieldset>
                <label for="testinput2">TestInput2:</label>
                <input id="testinput2" type="text" required="true"/>
            </fieldset>
        </form>
        <input id="testcase1" type="button" value="test1" />
        <input id="testcase2" type="button" value="test2"/>
        <script>
            document.getElementById("testcase1").addEventListener("click",click1,false);
            document.getElementById("testcase2").addEventListener("click",click2,false);
            function click1() {
                var form = document.getElementById("testform1");
                var expression = document.createExpression("//input[@type='text' or not(@type)]", null);
                var xpathResult = expression.evaluate(form, XPathResult.FIRST_ORDERED_NODE_TYPE, null);
                var element = xpathResult.singleNodeValue;
                element.value = "test1";
            }
            function click2() {
                var form = document.getElementById("testform2");
                var expression = document.createExpression("//input[@type='text' or not(@type)]", null);
                var xpathResult = expression.evaluate(form, XPathResult.FIRST_ORDERED_NODE_TYPE, null);
                var element = xpathResult.singleNodeValue;
                element.value = "test2";
            }
        </script>
    </body>
</html>

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.load testcase
2.click on test1 -> show TestInput1: test1
3.click on test2 -> show TestInput1: test2
Actual Results:  
click on test2 displays TestInput1: test2

Expected Results:  
click on test2 displays TestInput2: test2

works not for Firefox 3,4 and Safari (if I misunderstand the context argument than wise me up)
